text: Barron's is an American weekly magazine/newspaper. It is published by Dow Jones & Company, a division of News Corp. It was founded in 1921 by Clarence W. Barron (1855â€“1928) as a sister publication to The Wall Street Journal. Each issue provides a summary of the previous week's market activity as well as news, reports, and an outlook on the week to come. Category:American weekly magazines Category:1921 establishments in the United States
title: Barron's
